messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level B1

Text saved: Lewis likes to see the number of marine protected areas (places in the ocean set aside to keep wildlife safe) rise from 3 % to 10 % of the world’s seas. He wants to undo the damage caused by human actions such as overfishing, pollution and littering.  

During his trips, Lewis has seen this damage himself. He has swum over coral reefs (living structures made of tiny sea animals that build hard skeletons) that are bleached by warmer water. He also watched underwater deserts under the shallow waters of the Red Sea, where no life exists and plastic is everywhere.  

Pugh thinks that nature can recover if it is given enough space, but the clock is ticking. If we do not start caring for our seas, we may soon face a problem that is very hard to solve.
